intro: Panicum rarum, commonly known as the rare panicgrass, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Panicum rarum is considered a rare and endangered species. Its botanical study is important for understanding biodiversity in its native ecosystems.
